title: Medical scan diagnosing system
abstract: A medical scan diagnosing system is operable to receive a medical scan. Diagnosis data of the medical scan is generated by performing a medical scan inference function on the medical scan. The first medical scan is transmitted to a first client device associated with a user of the medical scan diagnosing system in response to the diagnosis data indicating that the medical scan corresponds to a non-normal diagnosis. The medical scan is displayed to the user via an interactive interface displayed by a display device corresponding to the first client device. Review data is received from the first client device, where the review data is generated by the first client device in response to a prompt via the interactive interface. Updated diagnosis data is generated based on the review data. The updated diagnosis data is transmitted to a second client device associated with a requesting entity.
claims:
1. A medical scan diagnosing system, comprising:
a processing system that includes a processor; and
a memory that stores executable instructions that, when executed by the processing system, facilitate performance of operations that include:
receiving, via a network, a first medical scan;
generating first diagnosis data of the first medical scan by performing a first medical scan inference function that utilizes a computer vision model on the first medical scan;
transmitting, via the network, the first diagnosis data to a first client device, and wherein the first diagnosis data is displayed to a first user in conjunction with the first medical scan via an interactive interface displayed by a first display device associated with the first client device;
generating a plurality of other diagnosis data, wherein each of the plurality of other diagnosis data is generated by performing the first medical scan inference function on a corresponding one of a plurality of medical scans, wherein the plurality of medical scans includes the first medical scan;
determining a subset of the plurality of other diagnosis data is incorrect; and
automatically generating an updated first medical scan inference function, based on determining a size of the subset exceeds a predetermined threshold, by training the updated first medical scan inference function on a training set.
2. The medical scan diagnosing system of claim 1, wherein the operations further include:
receiving, via a network, a second medical scan;
generating second diagnosis data of the second medical scan by performing the updated first medical scan inference function on the second medical scan; and
transmitting, via the network, the second medical scan to the first client device associated with the first user of the medical scan diagnosing system, wherein the second medical scan is displayed to the first user via the interactive interface displayed by the first display device corresponding to the first client device.
3. The medical scan diagnosing system of claim 2, wherein the operations further include:
receiving, via the network, second review data from the first client device, wherein the second review data is generated by the first client device in response to a second prompt displayed by the first display device via the interactive interface to provide the second review data;
generating updated second diagnosis data based on the second review data; and
transmitting, via the network, the updated second diagnosis data to a second client device associated with a requesting entity.
4. The medical scan diagnosing system of claim 1, further comprising a user database that includes a plurality of registered entities that includes a requesting entity, wherein the first medical scan is received from a second client device associated with the requesting entity, and wherein the operations further include:
retrieving usage data corresponding to the requesting entity from the user database in response to receiving the first medical scan; and
generating the first diagnosis data in response to determining the usage data compares favorably to a usage quota.
5. The medical scan diagnosing system of claim 1, wherein the operations further include:
receiving, via the network, first review data from the first client device, wherein the first review data is generated by the first client device in response to a first prompt displayed by the first display device via the interactive interface to provide the first review data; and
determining that the first review data indicates that the first diagnosis data is incorrect.
6. The medical scan diagnosing system of claim 5, wherein the first review data includes second diagnosis data, wherein the second diagnosis data is generated by the first user that differs from the first diagnosis data.
7. The medical scan diagnosing system of claim 1, wherein the operations further include:
selecting the first medical scan inference function from a plurality of medical scan inference functions based on a first medical scan classifier corresponding to the first medical scan.
8. The medical scan diagnosing system of claim 7, wherein the operations further include:
generating a new medical scan classifier by performing a medical scan classifier function on the first medical scan;
wherein the first medical scan inference function is selected based on the new medical scan classifier in response to determining that the first medical scan classifier compares unfavorably to the new medical scan classifier.
9. The medical scan diagnosing system of claim 8, wherein the first medical scan classifier is indicated in metadata of the first medical scan, retrieved from a medical scan database, and wherein the operations further include:
generating updated metadata corresponding to the first medical scan based on the new medical scan classifier; and
mapping the updated metadata to the first medical scan in the medical scan database.
10. The medical scan diagnosing system of claim 7, wherein the operations further include:
determining to split a scan category associated with the first medical scan classifier into multiple subcategories; and
generating the updated first medical scan inference function and a second updated first medical scan inference function based on determining to split the scan category, wherein the updated first medical scan inference function corresponds to a first one of the multiple subcategories, and wherein the second updated first medical scan inference function corresponds to a second one of the multiple subcategories.
11. A method for execution by a medical scan diagnosing system that includes a processor, the method comprising:
receiving, via a network, a first medical scan;
generating first diagnosis data of the first medical scan by performing a first medical scan inference function that utilizes a computer vision model on the first medical scan;
transmitting, via the network, the first diagnosis data to a first client device, and wherein the first diagnosis data is displayed to a first user in conjunction with the first medical scan via an interactive interface displayed by a first display device associated with the first client device;
generating a plurality of other diagnosis data, wherein each of the plurality of other diagnosis data is generated by performing the first medical scan inference function on a corresponding one of a plurality of medical scans, wherein the plurality of medical scans includes the first medical scan;
determining a subset of the plurality of other diagnosis data is incorrect; and
automatically generating an updated first medical scan inference function, based on determining a size of the subset exceeds a predetermined threshold, by training the updated first medical scan inference function on a training set.
12. The method of claim 11, further comprising:
receiving, via a network, a second medical scan;
generating second diagnosis data of the second medical scan by performing the updated first medical scan inference function on the second medical scan; and
transmitting, via the network, the second medical scan to the first client device associated with the first user of the medical scan diagnosing system, wherein the second medical scan is displayed to the first user via the interactive interface displayed by the first display device corresponding to the first client device.
13. The method of claim 12, further comprising:
receiving, via the network, second review data from the first client device, wherein the second review data is generated by the first client device in response to a second prompt displayed by the first display device via the interactive interface to provide the second review data;
generating updated second diagnosis data based on the second review data; and
transmitting, via the network, the updated second diagnosis data to a second client device associated with a requesting entity.
14. The method of claim 11, wherein a user database that includes a plurality of registered entities that includes a requesting entity, wherein the first medical scan is received from a second client device associated with the requesting entity, and wherein the method further comprises:
retrieving usage data corresponding to the requesting entity from the user database in response to receiving the first medical scan; and
generating the first diagnosis data in response to determining the usage data compares favorably to a usage quota.
15. The method of claim 11, further comprising:
receiving, via the network, first review data from the first client device, wherein the first review data is generated by the first client device in response to a first prompt displayed by the first display device via the interactive interface to provide the first review data; and
determining that the first review data indicates that the first diagnosis data is incorrect.
16. The method of claim 15, wherein the first review data includes second diagnosis data, wherein the second diagnosis data is generated by the first user that differs from the first diagnosis data.
17. The method of claim 11, further comprising:
selecting the first medical scan inference function from a plurality of medical scan inference functions based on a first medical scan classifier corresponding to the first medical scan.
18. The method of claim 17, further comprising:
generating a new medical scan classifier by performing a medical scan classifier function on the first medical scan;
wherein the first medical scan inference function is selected based on the new medical scan classifier in response to determining that the first medical scan classifier compares unfavorably to the new medical scan classifier.
19. The method of claim 18, wherein the first medical scan classifier is indicated in metadata of the first medical scan, retrieved from a medical scan database, and wherein the method further comprises:
generating updated metadata corresponding to the first medical scan based on the new medical scan classifier; and
mapping the updated metadata to the first medical scan in the medical scan database.
20. The method of claim 17, further comprising:
determining to split a scan category associated with the first medical scan classifier into multiple subcategories; and
generating the updated first medical scan inference function and a second updated first medical scan inference function based on determining to split the scan category, wherein the updated first medical scan inference function corresponds to a first one of the multiple subcategories, and wherein the second updated first medical scan inference function corresponds to a second one of the multiple subcategories.
